There are some great things about South Common - huge parking lot (since it's not easily accesible by transit), plenty of theatres (so some movies have space to play a few weeks longer), and a lot of food options (although none of it is very good for you - pizza, popcorn, candy, frozen yogurt, and the like).

The theatres here are big, with pretty comfy seats, too. Sat up in the top row for Harry Potter and the seats even leaned back a little bit. Bathrooms get line-ups, of course, but they do have a ton of stalls.

South Common is a very busy theatre, though! Get here early for your favourite midnight show and be prepared to stand in line for a looong time.

Not bad, not bad...  Aside from the initial slow service, I tried their signature Elmo Cola which was your choice of a glass-bottled coke or Diet coke with infused Maker's Mark, Maraschino cherries and Madagascar Vanilla Beans. Served with their famous drunken cherries. Really tasty! Think of like a more complex Vanilla Coke! I enjoyed it! The glass bottle of Coke is s nice touch too.

Sitting at the bar, we were tempted to order food as we saw orders and orders of their cocktail shrimp going out. Those shrimp were huge! But I noticed that the shrimp wasn't cleanly deveined so I didn't wanna take a chance. Anyways, nice ambiance of classy old cocktail lounge with low lighting. Definitely worth a stop to grab a round! 'Til next time, cheers!

I'll be upfront. I really like this spot and it's a great location for fun, debauchery, a fun time, meetup spot before a big night out, and access to some damn tasty bites. They're always doing fun and eclectic themed concepts but I really enjoy the full grounds Barcadia has.

Drinks are great and very well priced. Not to mention it's DOG FRIENDLY. So I love seeing pups come here and my dog loving self to get excited.

There's plenty of street parking around the area so it's quite easy to park around the area. I haven't had the chance to do lunch here but when I'm working out of a nearby coffee shop there's a pretty solid crowd.

I don't stop in at a lot of Starbuck ' s anymore...mostly because what I enjoy there is high in calories and the prices are generally too high.  That said, this location is very convenient if you are a student at St. Joe's or here for a visit.  

We got in from the cold, miserable weather amd warmed up with a hot chocolate, a Chai tea, and my triple shot white chocolate mocha...all while my daughter was out in the cold playing field hockey (yes that was mean).

Pleasant staff, quick service, consistent drinks.  Only issue is there was no sign up telling us the password for the wi-fi.

Little Mexico's namesake just does not live up to the standard in this area of Tucson. With so many selections of restaurants serving delicious, homegrown Mexican food, the restaurant needs to step it up a bit. 

The downfall on this visit: The too stale chips and bland refried beans were among them. And chicken wings?! Interesting addition - though they were actually pretty good. 

So, what does Little Mexico have going on? The service is good and the portions are insane here! My plate alone - three fish tacos with a side of beans and rice - could have been shared with at least one other person. Maybe two. No lie! And the nachos my friend ordered were massive. Stacked high in a deep plate teeming with cheeses and grilled meat. But so strange: There were the smallest dollops of sour cream and guacamole for this colossal stack of nachos!

One other weird thing: The fish tacos were pretty tasty. But when I ordered them I asked the server what type of fish the chef was using. She literally said, "I don't know. It's fish." *sigh*...goodness people.

Cheng Du how do you do? Classic Sichuan cuisine that is delicious and priced right. Located in Paoli shopping center makes for easy parking. BYOB since they don't sell any alcohol here. To gauge the spiciness of the dish with 10 being the hottest. Look for the number attached to the dish. You can ask them to adjust the level to your comfort level. 

Liked: Great balance of flavors and textures:
1. Spicy beef noodle soup 
2. Bok choy with shitake mushrooms 
3. Pork kidneys
4. Kung pao chicken
5. Dan dan noodles 

Liked a little less:
1. Spicy dumplings - The dumplings tasted like the ones you buy in an Asian supermarket. 
2. Fried pork ribs with fried panko bread crumbs - They tasted like ribs you would get at a big box store. 

The staff was cordial as we were seated promptly and tea was brought over. Portion sizes were generous and the Sichuan peppercorns, garlic and chili peppers gave our dishes a sweet and fruity numb tingling punch that was well accepted. 

They accept Major credit cards and if you pay in cash they'll give you a discount.

Impressive. We went to the Taste of Seminole Heights walking tour this past weekend, and it began here. We've never been before, so we stopped inside to utilize our tickets for two beers. However after we ordered two beers the bartender advised us that the sample size beers or outside and then we would have to pay for our beers. We took one sip and we were fine with that deal. We found some other people that we knew and gave them our sample beer tickets. I had a Funky Kolsch Medina, and loved it. Light, crisp and perfect for a warm day filled with walking. Sitting at the bar it took me a little while to figure out what was actually going on inside of this shop, I guess I'm just a little slow sometimes. There were all of these blue bins and I thought that it was just some of the supplies that they were using to brew their beer. To me it was interesting that they would just sort of be out in the open. After I got about halfway through my beer, I realized that this wasn't just a brewery, it was a place that sold supplies for people who make homebrew and wine. I know absolutely nothing about brewing beer or making wine but that didn't stop me from walking around and taking a look at the wares. I've got to tell you that I wasn't really sure about what half of the stuff was, but it looked pretty cool. There were cheese cloths, corks, tubing, live yeast, dry yeast and hops for days. There was a guy in there with a buscarte and long list of supplies that he needed, and it was cool to see him stocking up. Like I said, I don't know anything about making beer, but what I can tell you is that I've never actually seen a place that offers supplies for people who want to brew. For me, that makes this place very unique.

After we completed the Taste of Seminole Heights tour, we came back into Southern Brewing and had two more beers before heading home.

Loved the place, loved the staff and will definitely be back.

Came here for a quick bite to eat before seeing a movie in Olde City.  We ordered a few tapas (spring rolls, hummus & pita, spinach and artichoke empanadas) and enjoyed ourselves.  There was nothing particularly outstanding about the food, which is a shame because the total came to about $30.  The amount of food was fine for what we were going for (just a little something to tie us over for the film) but $15 does not warrant "snack food," you know?

I wouldn't be against coming back, but I probably wouldn't suggest it, either.

The best zoo I have ever been to. We went on a weekday, so it was not crowded. The weather was perfect, and almost all of the animals were out and very animated.

It was cheap too, $12.50 for adults, plus we had a coupon so we got in for $10 each.

This zoo is kept up very well, and the animals appear to be happy in their element. Very few of them are behind glass or screens/bars. It is a very open zoo, and the layout is beautiful.

My favorite parts were the gorillas, the orangutans, the swamp area and the white tigers.

We also found getting there to be very easy - we took the street car up to Audubon Park, it drops you right in front of the park entrance. You can either walk the mile through the park (no thanks) or just wait a few minutes, and somebody will come pick you up in a Jeep and take you to the zoo entrance. When you are done at the zoo, hop back in the Jeep and they take you back to the street car - all for free. How awesome is that?

This is Picasso's second location, found in the "Street's of St. Charles".  "The Streets" get crazy busy with traffic.  Don't waste time driving up and down looking at four outdoor parking spots.  Enter from the huge parking garage. You can park for FREE in the garage.  Stay dry in all the weather St. Louis can throw at you and ride the garage elevator up to the forth floor.  Picasso's has an entrance in the hallway so you never have to go outside!

Picasso's Barista's make some amazing Latte's.  The Milky Way Latte is the best coffee house blend I have had to date. It is pure bliss in a warm mug.  The Milky Way is Chocolate, Vanilla, and Caramel.  The Snicker Latte comes in a close second.  The Snicker blend is Chocolate, Caramel, and Hazelnut.  The Black Forest is also very good.  The Black Forest is Chocolate, Cherry, and Almond.  You really can not go wrong with any of the above Latte's...go ahead and indulge!

Only bummer- if you order a Venti your latte will be served in a to-go cup.  We did not see any signage about this and were not told when order was placed.  I guess I can save some money and order Grande's only.  

It seems they have already outgrown the seating they have at this location.  There is plenty of floor space for them to add more seating in the future.  

I look forward to trying the Nitro Cold Brew this Spring or Summer.

If you like Ethnic cuisines, as much as I do, then you're probably off to another exotic  restaurant trying a new and/or a traditional dish. If you haven't tried Laotian food yet, put it down on your to-try list! Even though I prefer Thai over it. 
I went to Ratchada for a late dinner on a Saturday night, the restaurant was handsome & clean, and the staff were very friendly and attentive. I started with Khao Jee that's grilled sticky rice seasoned with eggs shaped like heart (so good), and it was served with beef jerky which I did't care much for. I picked Om Laos Chicken as my entree. I rarely pick vegetables or soups for a meal, but I did. One thing for sure: It was so herby, and so fragrant. 
I'll come again to try the Thai food here.

Three and Half Yelps.

As I've been dabbling into meditation more and more, I've noticed Mama's Wellness Joint keeps popping up across my social feeds. Finally, the stars aligned and my schedule worked out so I was able to attend a session. 

The space is lovely, with a nice reception area that has a pretty cool gift shop. Shoes have to be removed before heading into the main room, and there is plenty of space for that. 

The practice room has a very soothing feel. For my session, only a few small spotlights provided some low lighting, and we made ourselves comfortable with the blankets and bolsters provided. 

Mama's offers yoga, but there are a handful of meditation practices offered for all types of interests, by a variety of practitioners. I'm excited to explore more of these in the future!

Pretty good PJ's with nice booths and free WiFi if you have work to do. I stopped in here to get my usual iced coffee and it was the usual good PJ's coffee that I really like. 

My one complaint about the place is they wouldn't honor a coupon I had. They explained that the coupon could only be honored at certain locations, but there was nothing on the coupon that said that- it just said I could use it at any PJ's location. Anyway, I went to my regular PJ's a few days later and they not only honored the coupon, but they told me that it can be honored at any PJ's and the folks at this place screwed up. Long story short: the staff here didn't know what was going on. Other than that, the place is okay.

So glad I randomly found this place before leaving PA.  We needed something quick to take to go for breakfast.  I ordered via phone and requested the foyager sandwich which is eggs, kale, oyster mushrooms, cheese on a bun.  I asked for them to cut it in half and add ketchup since they didn't have any packets to go.  I got there and decided to get a latte while I waited.  I loved the interior of this restaurant.  Not a lot of seating but very quaint.  I loved that the kitchen was right there where we can see everything they're doing.  They cut the sandwich in half but no ketchup however I wasn't disappointed.  The sandwich was packed with flavor.  I absolutely loved the added touch of the oyster mushrooms!

Happy Hour Review!

Oyster House has a few buck-a-shuck happy hour times. We visited for their Saturday evening specials.  Of course, we were greeted by a wait - guess we weren't the only ones thinking it was a good deal - but the hostess kept us informed and we were also able to grab drinks at the bar.  HH specials include $1 oysters and clams, $3 shooters, along a discounted beer and cocktail.  Once we managed to get a seat, our service outright sucked.  I'll blame it on our waitress, who seemed more interested in gossiping with friends than taking orders and getting food.  Yet, even she couldn't push our spirits down thanks to some top quality oysters and a pair of shooters.  We enjoyed everything so much, we decided to give clams a try... ok, turns out they aren't are thing.

In the end, we'll certainly be back.  Of course, we'll be hoping for a better waitress since they ran out of chowder thanks to her slower than slow service.  Just imagine how good everything else was if I am complaining that much about service and still happy to hand out a 4-star review.

Yelptastic way to ring in the Holidays with an outpouring of Yelpers opening their hearts by showing up at Raising Cane's dining room, made private for the night with a plethora of unwrapped toys piling high under a Christmas Tree for many deserving kids in our community.

With the smell of chicken wafting in the air, Yelp swag bags handed out by CM in-training Emre - he was absolutely the cutest, showing everything in my bag andd making sure that I scored a few candy canes - thank youuu!! How can you not get in the Christmas spirit along with our CM host Michael T. greeting us as we each entered the door and have a grateful heart.

The last Yelp event of the year is ALWAYS one of my faves with having me finish the night with my heart & belly INCREDIBLY full.  The Box Combo w/4 Chicken Fingers, Crinkle-Cut Fries, Cane's Sauce, Texas Toast, Coleslaw & Lemonade was absolutely daBOMB!! The chicken was absolutely tender and tastyyy!!

Seeing the outpouring of gifts/toys from the generosity of the Yelp community = heart FULL!  Finally seeing Yelpers in person, sitting in the dining area, the laughter, conversations and smiles in the time that I was there and it goes without saying that we all enjoy the hospitality of our host CM Michael T. this evening at Raising Cane's was a nice way to gather us together.

Thank you to Raising Cane's, Yelp, CM Michael T. (p.s. Happyy Happy Birthday), CM In-Training Emre,  plus the generous Yelpers that opened your hearts for the deserving kids in our community ~ Wishing you ALL A Very Merry Christmas and an Incredibly Blessed New Year!!

With Sinatra playing in the background, we grabbed a table early on a busy Saturday night for a little New York tomato pie. 

An institution in the City, Grimaldi's now has outposts in 14 states...including the most unlikely states of Alabama, Kansas and Idaho!

Florida, however, has so many transplanted New Yorkers that you just knew the Tampa restaurant would know how to put a nice pie together...and that they did. 

After trying the Caprese Salad, we loaded an 18" traditional w/ pepperoni, Italian sausage, onions, 'shrooms, green peppers and extra red sauce.  It came out of the brick oven smokin'. 

A really good pie with great service and low key New York ambience (love that omnipresent Sinatra).  I'm going all the way with 5 bright ones.

Stopped here for the second time since the new owners have taken over and it wasn't a pleasant experience. I ordered at the bar which was a surprise since for food you could order at the kitchen. Three of us coming of a long bike ride were starving and I was so ready for a hot roast beef. 20 minutes later my friends food came and mine didn't, when I asked the waitress she said it was coming. 20 minutes later when the food didn't come I went to cancel and the kitchen was closed so apparently my order was lost somewhere in the process. This is the second time ive been disappointed by the new regime. Sad because this was one of my favorite spots.

ナッシュビル空港にて早めのランチを探していたのですが、ベリーフィールドだけがローカルな野菜を使ったサラダを提供していました。他の所はアメリカの典型的な朝食メニューかハンバーガーとかいうものしかなかったので、ここのお店を見つけた時は嬉しかったです。

しかしながら注文したサラダの中に小さなゴキブリの死体が入ってました。レジの人に言ったらすぐ謝罪、返金さらに他の物をオファーしてくれましたが断りました。

接客が良くメニューもわりとヘルシーな物、ローカルなものが多かったので残念でなりません。


I was looking for something for my brunch and berry field was the only place offering salad using local ingredients at Nashville Airport.  The rest of the dining options were breakfast items, burgers and stuff.  So I was actually really excited to try this place.  

Everything was good until I found a small dead roach in my salad. The cashier person was very apologetic and gave me a refund quickly and offered something else too, which I didn't take.  

It was just unfortunate because I liked the customer service and what they offered.

All I've eaten here is the chicken and beef roll.  Both of them are very good.  If you have some time during lunch, its worth trekking over here(as it is a little bit off the beaten Penn path).

The food takes a while to make but you can be entertained by wacky foreign television during the wait.

A nice little niche place to hear great music, poetry and the performing arts. I came here for the first time when they hosted a tribute for the late great Dr. Maya Angelou. The poetry and performances were very moving. I will be back.

I almost went rogue and got the 'signature item' Pizano. The cheesesteak was small but did have a little flavor. It came with Fries which I always love. The place was small, bright, clean, everyone seemed to know each other and it looked like a (small) crowd was coming in for Karaoke.

NYE was extremely crowded during lunch with a long line out the door, but it moved very quickly and the staff were as friendly as ever.  We got our pepper cheese steaks with extra fried onions, and the famous finely chopped juicy and tender ribeye pretty quickly, given the shoulder-to-shoulder crowd, and they were just as delicious as always.  The meat is the best part and they give you PLENTY of it, along with generous portions of toppings and cheese.  They were also kind enough to cut mine into quarters, which makes the monster steak more manageable, in terms of eating.  I barely finished half of mine (I would rec splitting unless you want leftovers) but that means that I have a wonderful leftover dinner to look forward to tomorrow evening(toast in oven at 350 degrees for 5 min).  The only downside is that you can't really eat in unless you like wolfing down a sandwich at an overcrowded counter, but we usually get our cheesesteaks to go, anyway, unless we happen to be at Citizen's Bank Park.  Eating a cheesesteak kinda kills all of Emily Post's dinner etiquette rules in one fell swoop.

*Please note, I was sampling root alcohol when I was inside of here.And that alone is capable of construing and greatly affecting my feeling for this place. especially when there's a DJ spinning good music in the background, and an art wall to go along with the theme of the booze.*

But with the above thrown into consideration, hot damn is this place awesome. I've been checking it out since around the time of it's beginning. But it took me a while to find it on here just because of the fact that I affectionately call it Compass just because of what it logo and sign remind me of (I guess I'm a dork too - http://wwwdelivery.superstock.com/WI/223/1538/PreviewComp/SuperStock_1538R-47673.jpg).

Overall the store is an interesting treasure trove to walk through. It's filled to the brim with interesting books, cool shoes, soap. nice looking bags, addicting T Shirts, and other cool trends of fashion. But to be honest the main flaw to a lot of the items on the whole can be the price tag. While I love and am sold on the idea of owning a Chewbacca and Moustache Logo T Shirt, I'm not necessarily sold on the idea of owning them for $34 a shirt. And that's just the basics.

But at least that price tag does go to a valuable message statement. And here's only part of it -

"Our story begins in Philadelphia, a city of Brotherly Love, do-it-yourself initiatives, and collectives of inspired artmakers. Since 2006, Art In The Age of Mechanical Reproduction has existed as a vehicle through which modern thinkers marry reverence for enlightened ideals with the mandate to reach more minds in an ever-fickle urban scene. Our community of free thinkers and artistic innovators delivers inspiration and aspiration back to The People."

And that's the exact idea that runs rampant inside of it. It gives local artists a shot and supports free thought on every given occasion. And it does it ten fold during First Friday since it's in Old City. You'll enjoy a fine beverage such as root alcohol and check out a DJ just like I did. And there's worthy theme of art or history (or both on the wall), and plenty of interesting fashion to take in. And it is Idea's like all of the above that are worth supporting in the long haul.

Solid 4 stars. The word fun is sound of rice in Chinese. This make up their store name. Very good name. The poke is also fun to have also. They are kind tuck away from plaza. It is a bit difficult to get to. 

First choose the base. They have something most of the poke place do not have it. Soba Noodle as a base. They do have other base like rice, salad, brown rice which no interest me. Second choose two protein. I got the tuna and salmon. Third 5 mixed in. I got the cucumber, cherry tomato, mango, pineapple and last with shiitake mushroom which not use by most poke place. They have the protein and mixed in combo with sauce and stir the mix before put in to the base. Good technique. 

The topping selection has 4. I got crab meat, seaweed salad, octopus and masago. Considering this good topping. Food is a bit expensive but has good topping and base. I would make some changes with sesame seed, bonito flake and onion crip to free add on instead count as topping. This will give customers willing to come back because they got something extra.

Great new food truck corral that features food from home and around the world. My favorite was Johnny's Jamaican, they feature a chicken curry that is my highest recommendation. The seasonings are excellent matched with greens plantains, rice and peas for $10, its a great deal. They are only open for lunch on the weekends. Its a great stop on a bike ride. I dont think they have done a great job getting the word out but that should change soon. Hey they even have a DJ.

Why 4 stars? Because I appreciate the level of hipsterness here.

   ---   ---   ---

I'm a vicarious hipster, in that, I love their taste in coffee, beer, food, music, and their ability to set up shop in a struggling area. 

New Orleans is full of questionable hoods, and the Joint was definitely up there with the most interesting. It looks like a giant bomb went off across the street within the last 6 months. In any other city, this would not be a place to be walking around, but NOLA plays by different rules.

I had the pulled pork, brisket, mac, and potato salad. It was all well above average, but not quite touching the "Holy Mother of God" status. I eat BBQ as often as my body can take it, and trying the best of the city is usually a required stop on any new place that I visit. I'm glad I stopped at The Joint as my last stop before leaving this foodie-heaven of a city. 

As a whole, New Orleans lived up to the hype. I'll be back.

I've been to Upperline twice and both times were wonderful. The duck is amazing and offered with your option of sauce. Fried oyster appetizer was great. Taste of New Orleans dish  was very good with the étouffée being something really special and different. Desserts were great too: bread pudding, pecan pie. Great wine list and the owner is delightful and always out to make sure you are happy. Such a charming neighborhood gem.

Santa Barbara is a great place to ride bikes and this is the place to rent it from.  My friend and I decided to skip the cheesy and rent regulr cruiser bikes which are $8.95 per hour.  You can get a basket and a lock for free along with the bike.  Driving down State Street during Cinco De Mayo traffic was half fun and half risky because you just never know if some drunk college kid turns right into you.  I recommend going up through the residential area to the SB mission which is beautiful and a much easier ride especially on the way back (because its downhill).  Loved it!

This place is definitely a hard "no" for me. I went last weekend for my friend's engagement party. We did have a rather large group - not sure what my friend's experience was as far as reservations go, but our group was for 25 people.

My boyfriend and I had already eaten so we just wanted drinks. Let's just say our waitress was not too happy at the thought of that. I did try one of their little mini muffins though - it was a jalapeño cornbread style one that had no flavor. I tried their Cajun Martini which I was pretty excited about, considering how unique it sounded. It was disgusting - pretty sure they use poor quality booze in that drink because the after taste was terrible. I didn't drink it and no one else wanted it. 

Anyway, the overall vibe of the place threw me off. People were raving about the performances and entertainment aspect, but we sang one song and that was it (mind you, this was also a Saturday night, when one might expect the most action). To me, Palace Grill is just some dilapidated building trying to pose as a restaurant.

As far as gyms go, it's all right with a lot more cardio machines than weights but I think that's the with a lot of places and I'm a visitor but my friend said the price he pays here are very easy on the wallet. I got a pretty good sweat in the weight area and am surprised to see all the amenities here: childcare, a lot of fitness class rooms, pool, lots of lockers and even a coffee station. With all they have going on and available it's an unpleasant surprise that their showers had nothing but ICE COLD water. 

I left soggy, cold and unwashed, definitely not something I want to be for too long after a workout.

Cool riverside park walk along the park and river. This Hillsborough River flow along the location make the strolling or jogging very desirable. The scenery ever changes along the river make this prime location. The house along the park has clear view toward the river and the park. 

We were here because live orchestra music in the park. Because it close to holiday, they play the Christmas and holiday music. Very pleasant. The park also is a home for canoeing and rolling boat area. There was boat parade when we visited the park. Children are roaming like not limit. 

There plenty tree cover for open air concert. The gazebo serve as a stage for the presentation. Love the Santa make available to the kid and old kid like me. It was great to see old friends from Yelp in a surprise meeting in the park.

Killer, and insanely delicious donuts every sweet tooth must try, because one kind of donut just might not never be enough. I've tried couple and my favorite was the French Toast donut- it surely satisfied my sweet tooth.

Three and Four Quarter Yelps.

I wish I had checked out yelp before deciding to come to this spot.  The Philadelphia Chinatown area has a few hand drawn noodle restaurants.  This one might not have been the best choice for me.

The noodles had good texture, but the flavor of the dish was pretty bland.  It needed more salt, and I'm the type of person that does not like food super salty...so if I'm asking for more salt, I can't imagine how it would have tasted to someone who needs their food sodium filled.

The restaurant gets three stars because the price was somewhat affordable, and they were SUPER FAST at getting the food out to me. Hopefully I'm wrong, and maybe the seafood hand drawn noodles was the wrong dish to order. I wont be in the area to try another dish, but just this is just an FYI to all you other yelpers out there....

My lil family and I love love love coming here!!

We love how we feel able to stay consistent with our health goals and can still have a very delicious and fun experience! We are always here when we are craving an incredibly tasty grub of a variety of seasonal and organically sourced ingredients! 

The food and service are on point always! They go above and beyond to accommodate our requests!

You've got to try the warm kale salad! Still my favorite! You can't go wrong with the Cod tacos! Let me tell you, seriously they are good! The salmon gyro was absolutely delicious! The Maple Maca Latte is a must! 

Pro tips: join their rewards program and don't hesitate to ask for a sample before you order! 

Way to go GFG!!

Stand alone pink little shack of a building.

You make your purchase outside. Do not enter, they will open a window.  

The display is not that visually appealing because it is suffocating due to the limited space.  What my eyes turned to first were the tartes because they seemed to be the focal point and took up the most space in the "display".  

Chocolate chip coconut macaroon: $0.50 - no plus or minus - just standard.

Pecan sweet potato tarte: $5.75 - This was quite lovely.  The sweet potato balanced it out so that it isn't overpowering with what would've been a whole lot of molasses.  This really is one of the better tartes that I have tried. 

The other items didn't interest me but I will definitely be coming back to try their other tartes.  

Parking: street metered

I was lucky that the first Muffuletta I tried also happened to be the best.

For prepared food, this place pretty much does just one thing, the muffuletta, and they do it extremely well. They are not shy at all about advertising all throughout and on the front of the store about how they are the home of the original muffuletta.

I am not usually the biggest fan of this type of sandwich (cold Italian deli meats), but this is a delicious sandwich. The regular size is definitely bigger than your head, so you should just go for the half, which is still big enough to share. I shared a half size with my wife since we just had beignets and were also planning on trying a few more muffulettas afterwards for a little taste test.

It was so good it had me wishing we got the full size one. Now that I've had the rest also, I would definitely come back here to get the best if I am in the mood for a straightforward, classic version of the muffuletta.

Good
Dive bar
Committed
To its style.
Has decent food and drink specials when broke.
Oysters are really fresh and good. Our waiter was really nice. Only bad thing was we had to sit in the other room though where they cook the oysters and it was really smoky and it hurt my eyes a bit.

I have only been here twice so far but I absolutely love this place. First time I came in I got a few tacos (wanted to try the steak, chicken, and chorizo) and all were perfectly delicious. This last time I went in I got another chorizo taco and I tried the carne asada torta which I was also very pleased with. It was about double the size of the torta's I have tried in the past, which I will admit has only been a couple, but I couldn't even finish it (which while I hate wasting food this is better than not getting enough). Everyone is always friendly and there are so many other items on their menu I would like to try and plan on making this is a regular place I eat at when visiting Reno.

I wish my kids were small again..This place is awesome..thank goodness I have a grandbaby girl..I will shop around here again and again...
LOVE THIS STORE...

I'm happy to see that Cask has really become a staple in SoHo since my last review! I met up with a few friends for Sunday brunch this past weekend and it was nicely populated. We decided to sit outside on the front deck but I probably would recommend sitting inside during summer months around here. It was really hot despite the fans that they have (if you don't mind the heat go for it because the people watching is great!).

First and foremost - our waitress Sydney was a DOLL!!! She was so attentive, patient, kind and friendly. Not to mention accommodating when we asked about possibly taking the table next to us for friends who wanted to join. She deserves a big kudos for her service. 

To start, I ordered the $5 Bloody Mary special and it was perfectly made. I also tried a Black Bubbles cocktail ($10) which was really refreshing and a nice drink for brunch. They do offer bottomless mimosas for $20 from 11-4 (there is a limit of 2 hours to drink them if you choose this). For my meal I had the Wild Mushroom Omelette ($10) which was jam packed with ingredients and they do offer egg whites if you ask for no additional charge. The brunch menu has a little something for everyone so if you have dietary needs this is probably a good place to go. 

Valet parking is complimentary in their lot, but make sure you have a couple bucks to tip. You are welcome to make reservations ahead of time and you can bring a group. Drinks are a little on the pricey side compared to other places in the area but are well made. They are kid and dog friendly so bring the whole family! They had a DJ out on the deck which was really nice for a relaxing Sunday. I'd recommend for brunch for sure!

I had a really good experience here. I attended an appreciation night for the Holiday Hamper program! Campio took really great care of us. We got to sample some of their food - the fried pickles are awesome, and try some of their beer. The service was awesome. 

Our little event took place in the basement, where they have a room for private parties. You also get a great view of the brewery area itself. 

Our server was very friendly, and she made sure the entire event was running smoothly from what I saw! 

I tried the "Decade of Darkness" Stout. It was unbelievable! I can be a stout snob but this did not disappoint. I would absolutely come back again. They have crazy deals on Oilers game nights. My plus 1 was super excited to come back on the 29th to capitalize on those deals.

This is a nice store - though a bit cramped.  It is not as good as Penzey's though - I bought granulated garlic at both and Penzey's was fresher and cheaper.

The salt-free lemon pepper blend from Spice corner looks promising and the service was excellent.  Nice staff working there.  Glad to see them in business.

With so many places to eat tacos on Nolensville, the tacos at Taqueria Express didn't stand out to me. They were fine (the lengua was a little gristly, and the carne asada was okay), but the wait for the tacos was longer than I typically expect for a taco truck. Definitely okay - not a bad meal. It just isn't a truck I'd go back to necessarily.

I was blown away by my experience here! I had about an hour to kill and needed to finish some work, so I popped in, thinking that it was a fast-casual spot. I arrived right when they opened and quickly saw that it was a nice sit-down spot (you can get takeout of course too!). I went ahead and took a table by myself and was quickly greeted by an incredibly kind and  attentive server.

The entire  restaurant felt so clean, thoughtful, and welcoming. Everything from their signs to their logo to  their menus are beautiful. Their team of sushi chefs were in their chef whites, chef hats, and looked incredibly polished and professional. I opened the menu and was wowed by the colorful, appetizing photos in the menu. I've truly never seen better food photography. It made me want to order literally everything. 

I went for the miso soup and Spideman Roll. It had crabmeat tempura, avocado, soft shell crab, eel sauce, spicy mayo, scallions and caviar. It was super delicious and the plating was beautiful. I was pleasantly surprised by the price too. For such a high quality spot, my meal was $15. I will absolutely be back for their ramen, udon noodles, and if I can get enough friends together, a future sushi boat. Do yourself a favor and visit this spot. It's unique and special... who else has a sweet potato sushi roll? YUM.

Came here years ago when the downtown area was still popular. Now not much is happening, even we only ended up staying for 30 mins. Actually, it was a walk around to Whitney Peak Hotel which still took 30 mins to find when they were right across the street.

This time, a retail Gap rather than an outlet Gap. Similarly laid out with lots of well folded clothes and displays of merchandise that were neatly stacked. Organized by size, but nothing bigger than a single XL (38-40). And since I'm bigger than that still, nothing here for me.

And then I spotted something that tells me that I don't need to spend much more time here. A sign indicates that XXL (42-44) are "online exclusive." Thanks, Gap!

[Review 10427 overall, 194 of 2019.]

My sister in-law wanted her birthday dinner to coincide with "Feeling BLUE my twenties are through" theme that offered a fun atmosphere to celebrate with family and friends. 
Besh is a CASINO steakhouse with casual-business-semi-formal attire, moderate to noisy noise level, and expensive wine and foods. 

Tip 1: Children are not permitted. 21 and older and bring a valid photo ID. 
Tip 2: You will not be seated until your entire party arrives. 
Tip 3: The restrooms are not located inside of the restaurant but in the casino area. 
Tip 4: Reservations are preferred especially for large parties. 
Tip 5: Offers valet parking.

We had a pre-set menu $75.00 per person for our party of sixteen that included: * rating below
-House made Natchitoches Meat Pies with buttermilk ranch dressing ***
-Crispy fried Oysters ***
-Besh Barbecue Shrimp ****
Entree
-Pan fried Catfish ***
Topped with shrimp, crab, asparagus, whipped bernaise 
        OR
-14oz. Prime Rib with fries ****
Dessert
Brenden's Bread Pudding ****

I am not a huge fan of fried food so I sampled the meat pies, fried oysters, and barbecue shrimp and they were flavorful. I should have known better than to order anything but steak at a steakhouse. The pan fried catfish was good but had too much going on for my taste. I would have preferred it alone and the toppings on the side. I did have some of my brother's Prime Rib cooked medium well and it was delicious- tender and juicy. The Brenden Bread Pudding was absolutely delicious especially if you love pecans. 

Our server Anthony was friendly and attended to our table as needed. We ended dinner with singing Happy Birthday and indulging in her custom made Blue Dog birthday cake. The chef was gracious enough to slice the cake as many of us were full and took it to go. 

Overall for the price I have had better food but it was a good experience to try at least once. 

Support local business! NOLA

Excellent first experience!  We stopped to see if they were open and they had us come in to try the food while they were working out the pre-grand opening kinks!  They were getting ready to stop serving for the "lunch rush" and start to prep for their evening "Friends and Family" event.  There was no line thankfully so we walked up and awkwardly ordered our meals.  I ordered Two Enchiladas (beef & chicken) and my wife ordered the mango chicken salad.   My enchiladas were good but we decided to focus our attention on the salad because it wouldn't hold up as a left over.  The salad was great with all the different types of salsa's that were available to be added to it.  It came in a tinfoil "take out" dish with a fresh soft heated tortilla under it.  I liked this different approach to the salad.  I personally wouldn't get it next time because the carb load was probably pretty high and it was almost impossible not to eat because it tasted sooo good.  We also were able to try the Tres Leches.



I needed to give that one space.  Because that Tres Leches was worth an entire star all by itself.


Tres Leches.


My daughter had a kids meal and called it good!  A picky eater satisfied is always nice with a new place.   We were also able to sample the Flan.  Man this place makes some amazing desserts.  All of the food is fresh made and they don't even have a walk in freezer.  I really like/fear the fresh made tortillas at the start of the line.  The fear is that I will indulge too much and not be able to even have a bite of the wonderful desserts.  I envy those people who can put away tons of carbs.

Even though they have Coke products on fountain they also are carrying "Mexican Coke" with real sugar.  And are planning on bringing in other flavors of real sugar Fanta.  So if you are a soda drinker this might be just the thing you are looking for.
They also have a few teas and at least one flavor of Horchata available.

The atmosphere of the place is nice  Lots of teal and beach colors really cheers the place up.  Stone and tile and wood moves you far from the Forrmica covered places quick serve Mexican you may be used to in the area.  They even have some big windows that can be opened during the warmer months for open air eating.  

The ordering process is similar to the other places, but has much more variety on the line.

I will be coming back to try the Daily Special.  A different menu item for $6.49 each day of the week and on Sunday you get "your choice" of any days special for $6.49.
Menu Prices are anywhere between $5-$8.39 depending on items ordered.  I didn't take note of guacamole or sour cream costs.  The amazing desserts are $3.49 and the kids meals are $3.99.

Parking is private and will be plentiful even on the most busy times because of the nearby vacant building.  Looking forward to going back and trying the Key Lime Pie as well as the tacos.

Always has been and still is one of my fav restaurants! Been here multiple times and never had a bad experience. Great food, great drinks, great music and decor. Fav dish to get is the cilantro grilled chicken! Yum yum yummy!

They have beef, turkey & veggie burgers! However, they are pretty much cooked on the flattop right next to each others, so if that bothers you....Maybe you could ask for them to clean a section and segregate? 

I got the au Naturale veggie burger with a side of curly fries. The smashed avocado was more like guacamole but I'm OK with that. The bun and veggie patty were both put on the grill and you can taste it. Very yummy. The curly fries were lightly battered and delicious. Ketchup and mustard were available at the truck to add yourself. 

Service was quick and I was back at my desk in no time, sigh.

I stayed at Silver Legacy so many times it's ridiculous. I love the rooms and the front desk staff for the most part has always been amazing. I feel safe staying here especially when going to the elevator to get to my my room as they have security The makes sure your suppose to be there. Nothing wrong with that in my book hotel should really do this to prevent seedy character from roaming around.

 They have many restaurants my favorite being Sterlings they have an amazing Sunday Brunch with all the delicious fixings..lol. They also have Flavor's Buffet which is just okay and another that l can't remember the name.

 My last stay here was quite lack luster though. I stayed here with a few friends and family. My first room I checked into the air didn't work, so I was put in another room this time the TV didn't work and the toilet didn't flush. They placed me in another room no problem. They upgraded me and everything was great until I get back to my room to go to sleep at 2:30am. Around 3:20am I hear the people next door to me fighting and I don't mean just yelling back and front like it was physical. I hear the man screaming for help and telling his ole lady to stop hitting him she was out of control the walls banging etc.. I call the front desk they send security up immediately to remove the woman. Front text comp'd my first night for the inconvenience which was nice. They following day they put me in a even a better room " Spa Room" which was a very kind even though I never asked to be moved, but hey! I was going to be here a few more nights.

 I would have given 5 stars but, after checking out and my bank calling me 2 days after I checked out of Silver Legacy they charged my card 2 extra nights after checkout. I called and they front desk manager fixed right away and apologized.

This is the quintessential dive bar and it's great! For those of you who are not into the dive bar experience or "scene" for lack of a better word, this place is not for you... For those of you who are, I highly recommend giving Cajun Mike's a shot. This is probably one of the coolest dives located just outside of the French quarter. Come in, get starred at and be friendly amongst the locals, that's the key to success at a place like this. Honestly, friendliness goes a long way... The brew is awesome, typical draft selections, a couple of TVs and some pretty good local pub grub. Enjoy the experience and take it all in, especially if you're a tourist.

Went tonight for "industrial" night at my friend Travis' suggestion.

Good bar.  Good crowd.  Good music.  I have seen a burlesque show here in the past, and the place was packed.

From what I hear, it is a lot how "Krystal" and "Dervish" used to be.  I can't speak to that, it was before my time.

I went and had a good time.

I was a little afraid of this cheesesteak. Irish pub in a strip mall doesn't scream great cheesesteak.  I saw a prime rib sandwich on the menu. I thought that was the sandwich I was supposed to try.  The bartender was convincing that he liked the Cheesesteak so I stuck with a cheesesteak.  It was on a sesame seed roll but it did not present itself.  It was sloppy and the cheese wasn't completely melted.  Surprisingly it was good.  The meat was tender and had a decent flavor.  Nice roll but I do not like it when they cut roll on an angle especially when the cheese isn't completely melted.  You're already having a tough time getting roll, meat and cheese in every bite. I also didn't like the $13.17 price tag.  I think the prime rib sandwich was $14 and it came with french fries.  I don't know, it was a good cheesesteak, draft of craft beer $6 and they have plenty of TVs.  I think it was a good overall experience.

I'm not a smoker, but my cousin visiting from Massachusetts wanted to find flavored vapes to bring back to her state. I searched Yelp and found Straight Pipes & Vapes nearby. We checked out their selection and was pleased to find cheaper prices than other vape stores in the area. The staff was very friendly and helped her as she browsed, even recommendation a different brand than the one she had set out to buy. The recommendation turned out to be better than what my cousin was used to. The store itself has lots of items for the experienced smoker and seems to have lots of inventory and variety. We had a great shopping experience and didn't feel pressured to buy or try anything that we didn't want. Excellent shopping experience at Straight Pipes & Vapes.

The menu is a bit confusing as it isn't the best organized and be aware that most of it is in Spanish so you will need some time to translate it with Google or have a working knowledge of some Spanish food terms if you're not fluent.  The service is inconsistent and while friendly could be more attentive to details.  The food is decent and they have nice freshly made tortillas.  The prices for several items seem higher than the nearby Taqueria Guerrero.  They have a breakfast menu that could appeal to those who like indulging in that meal with a Latin flair.  Overall I would generally prefer Taqueria Guerrero except the fresh tortillas here are some of the best around.

I have a problem.

I have been thinking about the vegetable samosas from Desi Chaat House a lot.  It is causing a serious interruption in my daily functioning.

Sometimes I will be in the middle of a conversation and I will pretend to get a call so that I can go outside, hail a cab, and go to Desi Chaat house for the samosas.  I return, sometimes an hour later, and attempt to continue the conversation as if nothing had happened.  My friends think I'm on drugs and my girlfriend is accusing me of having an affair but they don't know how much I love these samosas.

But Brad, why not introduce these people to Desi Chaat house?  

The answer is simple, hypothetical question-asker...it is because I am a man who's mind is rife with delusional paranoia.  I fear that my friends and loved ones, knowing my weakness, will buy out the samosas before I am able to get to the restaurant and they will sell them to me at ridiculous markups.  Like a hopeless addict, I will be enslaved to the wills of those I once trusted. 

Illogical? yes.  Impossible?  Nope.

...ok back to reviewing.

When you order them, they will offer to pour chickpeas over them.  Let them do this.  

The best way I could describe the chaat is...wacky.  It is a peculiar mix of sweet, spicy, creamy, and aromatics.  I've had the vegetable samosa and mumbai chaat and both are good.

The chicken roll and lamb roll make an excellent lunch.  The meat is tender and seasoned extremely well.  I highly recommend these items.  For a very vegetarian-leaning culture, India sure makes some excellent meat dishes.

On top of it all, the staff is ridiculously friendly and always asking for feedback on how they can improve.  It is tasty, inexpensive, unique, and has the best veggie samosas in Philadelphia.

Note: I like veggie samosas a lot more than most people so bear that in mind when you consider this review.

"You HAVE family in Santa Barbara that I don't know about?!"

My husband was shocked. 

That's how you keep it interesting and fresh! who says you stop discovering things about each other once you're married? ;-)

To be honest, I've been a bad cousin. No matter how many times we've gone down to SoCal, I've never really made it a point to connect with my long lost cousin. (it's been a decade!) 

Fast forward to last weekend when he recommended Los Agaves. We arrived first with my parents and were welcomed with a very PACKED and noisy Saturday night atmosphere. It was self explanatory: fall in line, order at the counter, grab your utensils and sit yourself at a free table. We needed assistance since there were 6 of us.

We only waited a short while until they showed up and it was quite the reunion! We kept ourselves busy while waiting for our food, stuffing our faces with the fresh made chips and varieties of salsa. You're a spice wuss? good luck. Even the most "mild" salsa has a pretty good kick to it. I'm def a wuss (wah, wah) but the green avocado salsa was thick and had a nice flavor to it, that I couldn't stop at just one chip!

Soon after, the real party came: massive steak burrito mojado ($10.95), several tacos del mar ($13.50) and grilled chicken fajitas ($16.25). I really loved the sweet mangoes that topped my fish tacos and that chipotle sauce worked its magic! All plates come with a nice heaping of Mexican rice and side salad. My mom and husband enjoyed their margaritas, but declared that the blood orange margarita had a better taste than the regular one. I was just jealous, since I couldn't partake because of lent :(

Los Agaves gave us a pleasant experience and definitely lived up to its reputation as an upscale Mexican restaurant. I love the generous portions too! I'm curious to try one of their Molcajetes next time I'm in Santa Barbara and I wouldn't let another 10 years pass by before I see my cousin again.

Overall I really like this Whole Foods Market. It is not as large as some of their other stores, such as the amazing mega WFM in Oxnard, but also not as tiny as the store in Hillcrest for my SD friends out there. 

I love going to the Buzz Hive, an intimate bar with great beer and wine selections, food made to order and large TVs that play most of the popular sporting events. 

Whole Foods is one of my go to markets for vitamin & herbal supplements and natural, organic beauty products. For my curly-haired guys and gals, they carry the incomparable, Kinky Curly line of hair products that will make even the tightest and most unruly of curls look defined, soft and amazing. 

I also enjoy ordering fish from the Seafood Dept and having them prepare it for me on my lunch or dinner breaks. They have some wonderful seasoning options. I recommend Tilapia (Blackened) and Shrimp (Grilled w/ Garlic Butter), mmm! On Fridays, fresh Oysters are only a $1 per piece and they'll shuck them for you. I love to order a dozen and take them over to the Buzz Hive to enjoy with a glass of white wine. 

The cheese shop is incredible. So many great frommages to choose from. Don't be shy about asking the staff for recommendations and/or samples. They are pros and generally are happy to oblige. Here's a pro tip: Look for the little basket in the cheese section for the ends and pieces of cheese. You can find some fabulous high end cheeses at perfect portions for one or two people that are very reasonably priced. I like to buy a few and take them on a picnic or to the Buzz Hive to enjoy with a big, bold red. 

I could go on and on but I don't want to spoil the fun of you discovering all the cool things about this location. 

Why not four stars? Sometimes customer service can be a miss. There have been less than cordial staff at the juice bar and in the meat dept, who strangely I haven't seen working there in a while so perhaps the problem has resolved itself, who really put a damper on the shopping experience. Also, I have heard that Whole Foods has a stellar return policy, however, the one time that I sought to use it to seek an exchange and/or refund for being given an entirely different pizza than we ordered with an ingredient that I am allergic to (Hubs didn't check the inside of the box before he got home. We called and the pizza dept said to let the manager know the next time that we were there) - we did and the manager at the front desk refused to honor it. Bummer. We've never ordered pizza from WF since and that was over two years ago. 

Other than that, it's a great market and we shop there regularly. If anyone at corporate is reading, a second location on the Eastside would thrive! With customers coming from Montecito, the Riviera, Downtown, the Funk Zone and the Eastside - I think it would be a hit! Check out the space where Fresh Market used to be on Milpas Street.

The Rec Room is a lot of fun and is surely worth a visit when in downtown Phoenixville. The rec room itself is my favorite part about this place. It's not often that you find a place where you can play ping pong and shuffleboard is usually tucked in the back of a dimly lit dive bar somewhere (not that there's anything wrong with that). So props for the concept of having both under one roof with good beer and food to boot!  

I'm a fan of Conshohoken beer and like that they have a variety of styles to choose from. On my most recent visit, they were out of quite a few beers due to the Blob fest event happening in town; but I was still able to grab a nice tasting IPA while I got some action in on the ping pong table. 

I've had food from here a handful of times now - with my last order being buffalo wings - they were good but tasted like they could've been frozen and reminded me of wings I'd have at Buffalo Wild Wings. Not terrible but not great  either. 

I'd absolutely come back again for the beer and balls of fury but will save my appetite for one of the other local jawns in town.

Absolutely delicious and perfectly cooked burgers that are not too big.  A little more expensive than 5 guys - but much better.

A great place for a haute-fast-food burger fix.

I got mine "Classic" with Cheddar.

No fries, no shake for me.  The burger was just enuf.

"Black bean corn fritters." I repeat, "Black bean corn fritters." And if you're seeking specifics, "black bean corn fritters topped with shoestring beets and a generous serving of an herb-based cream that hit the spot." 

For starters, way to go Shoefly for being one of the businesses to pave the way for development in the neighborhood - excellent location selection. 

Other noteworthy highlights from our cozy Friday night visit:
-go for the mulled wine served by the mug (Guhlwein is hard to come by in the Circle City) And for $4/$5, why not have a second?

-Herbed polenta - this thrown with another lighter side would be suitable for a satisfying meal

-salad: the $4 small options are a great route if you're looking to sample as much as possible from the menu. I opted for the Escarole salad and would probably consider making it my meal along with the shared black bean corn fritters on my next visit. Although...the beet hash might be calling my name...

-friendly service and overall laid back environment which makes the innovative and progressive menu all the more fun

-while I'm at it, if you're really hungry or hankering for a heavy option, I recommend giving the cheese cornmeal waffle sandwich filled with pulled pork a shot. The meat is extremely juicy and tender.

Reviewer # 19

I've been to this location probably 20 times over the last 5 years. The restaurant is always consistent and friendly. The same people have been working there for quite some time, which says a lot. 

The services is pretty traditional of a Mexican restaurant-- they bring you chips, salsa and beans and the menu is the usual. I, personally, haven't seen anything extra special, but then again I don't venture too deep into the menu. 

Consistency, good food, friendly service, and a good location keeps me comin' back!

Great location, good food, good lunch prices.

I went with three co workers for lunch and we got there right at 11:30 a.m. on a Friday.  At first, we were surprised that it was empty, but by half an hour later the outside tables were completely packed.  

The lunch prices are pretty decent with a meal being between around $10.  I got the Fettuccine Alfredo.  It was good, but a pretty small portion.  I was still hungry after eating, but I was pretty hungry before lunch.  It came with sundried tomatoes, which really added to it.  I think most of the lunch pasta dishes are on the small side, since my friend got the spaghetti and it was the same size as my fettuccine.  My friend got a tortellini salad, which was delicious.  I would definitely get that next time.

This is a nice, relaxing spot to get lunch.  It is right on Beach Drive, which means you can do a lot of people watching.  I like sitting actually on Beach Drive more than on the side street.

Taco Shop is where it's at for a late night snack. It's cheap and the food is mostly good. I would enjoy it more if they held back on the oil.  The menu had more offerings than you can read through when you're trying to make a light night decision, but alas, the fried beef tacos always come through with a side of rice and beans. Surprisingly the beans and rice have a touch more flavor than the tacos. And the salsa is spicy as can be. NO drive thru here friends. Walk in and take it to go.

Originally built in 1929, the restored historic Lovett Barn is now home to a trattoria that caters to homemade Italian cuisine. http://www.lastallarestaurant.com/menus/lastalla_dinner_menu.pdf

The pasta's and sauces are homemade, the prices are a little on the high side.  The dinner menu priced for two, can be split in half for one and add $3.00.  The clams casino are very good and seasoned perfectly with red pepper, onion and bacon.  

The Marsala dishes are exceptional, with your choice of chicken or veal.  They offer a large list of ways to have your chicken or veal, like Francese, parmigiano, saltimbocca and so on.

The choices of pasta entrees could drive you insane, you name it, they make it.  The choices for both lunch and dinner is a wide selection from the appetizers to the salads and the great variety of entrees.  The antipasto choices are more than most Italian restaurants offer.

Check them out at and while visiting their site, check out their calendar for discounts and half price bottle of wine nights.  They serve a Sunday buffet which is a great and tasty value.

You won't find me at a Vietnamese restaurant too often. I don't really like the traditional rice noodles, or vermicelli. (I guess I never was a big fan of noodles all together.) But my sister was dying to try this restaurant, so we decided to see what they had to offer.

The wait was quite long. The restaurant was simply packed with people. So I thought it might take a long time for the food to come out. But once we got seated, the server came and took our orders rather quickly, and the next thing I know, my dish was right in front of my face. We ordered Vermicelli with Charbroiled Shrimp, Vermicelli Combo, and Stir-Fried Vermicelli with Chicken. My boyfriend, who also came along, flipped over the Stir-Fried Vermicelli with Chicken dish. He actually claimed the dish as his, when we clearly ordered it to share. At the same time, I didn't find the restaurant too special: Not a place where I want to stop by whenever I'm in Philadelphia.

I would definitely never ever consider wearing a suit or shirt from here during 95% of the social and professional gatherings that I take part in. But sometimes you just need a place that helps make your inner character unfold, and The Shirt Corner can hook it up.

Every single shirt and suit I've seen here have been all kinds of tacky (there's very good reason why a suit doesn't go beyond $99). You won't find a swank pinstripe suit, or too many recognizable name brands. But you will find unnatural shades of purple, red, and green. with that said there's good reason you won't see me wearing anything from here under most normal circumstances. But one day I might just splurge some cash on a purple suit so I can dye my hair green and pull off a bad ass Joker costume!

When you randomly come across the legendary Baby Badness smoking a cigar outside of an interesting looking Rittenhouse Square bar, you instantly have to stop in and find out out what they're about. Especially when she was hospitable enough to honor McThrill Rule #347 (http://www.yelp.com/biz/mexican-post-philadelphia-2?hrid=B0Xyx41uJbg_Vc3JEYUSKg#src:self). And when upon entry you discover a bar & restaurant with impeccable exposed brick wall, a solid cocktail & draft beer menu, that is also a cheese lovers paradise that's operated by some experienced mongers, you succeed in finding divine paradise.

I only give the low end of 4.5 stars for now because finding the chance to savor menu items like a cheeseburger with bone marrow and Cabot cloth bound cheddar, a foie gras with potato asparagus salad and a sherry vinegar syrup, and Georgia shrimp on a bed of hand made fettuccine will elevate it higher (and that's not even with factoring the incredible sounding brunch items!). 

But what I did find was an impeccable cheese plate selection that's organized by a monger extraordinaire who has a background in working with Le Bec Fin and Per Se. And they even have the classic Le Bec Fin cheese cart which was a gift to them tfrom Chef Perrier! For us it delivered grand offerings like St. Angel, Scharfer Max, Selles Sur Cher, and Bonne Bouche. But between the extensive knowledge of both Michael and Alex, you're bound to be treated to something impressive.

add in a plentiful assortment of classic and new school cocktails, a solid selection of wines, and a solid list of bottled and draft beers that are noteworthy even if they are a touch overpriced, and you have a Rittenhouse Square hot spot that's worthy of a visit!

After many years of fanboying over their late night fried chicken, it seems that life has been good for the Brothers biz. Their influence has resulted in rapid expansion, ballooning up to over 30 additional locations all throughout Louisiana at the time of this review. Since you never forget your first (#1), this location will forever hold a special place in my glutton heart.

Obviously a lot has changed over the years. The place is most definitely cleaner and brighter than it's ever been. To some degree, the food has been refined, resulting in crispier chicken and meat pies have nearly become just as popular. There was a time when the chicken inventory was slim pickins in the wee hours, but now it's plentiful throughout the entire day / night.

With success comes higher prices (#2), but compared to similar spots, Brothers is still quite affordable. A 25 piece will run one about $22 and the associates here do a good job of picking out potentially juicy ones. I always recommend a good mix of white and dark meat, but that's just me. Individual piece choices are always a nice thing, and the drum sticks are hard to beat.

To many more years of success, late nights, and tasty fried chicken!
_____________
(#1) Oh. It was so good.
(#2) As well as a little something called *The Pandemic*

You can have no dominion greater or less than that over yourself."
- Leonardo da Vinci

Confession 1: I woke up one day with "back tits" and "clapping thighs!!!Sshhhh don't you dare judge! Not every girl has discovered Victoria's Secret for a the perfect body with a pretty face you know! So stop rolling your eye unless you got that magic brush to give me that PERFECT BODY!

Confeesion 2: It is NOT "All About That Bass"! 

Solution:  I decided to take responsibility for my own fitness, and It wasn't hard to find out that Unite Fitness is the way to go. I went there yesterday and it only took few minutes to know about the center, few minutes and I purchased a 10 pack package as a start. Liz was very helpful and friendly, she is one of the coachs as well. She explained how this awesome guided cross-training works:
- The workout is not too complicated, a combination of cardio( 30 min), strength(30 min) and stretching(15 min). 75 minutes  and your( and my) guts to get the job done.
- Classes has limited spots and reservations are required via an app and subject to availability.
- $10 fee for no show or late cancellations, as you are taking somebody's else spot. 
- Personal coaching & an intense boot camp are available. 
- Towels are available for $1.

As a first time client, I was eligible for one free trial workout in the group cross-training program, and I took it with Evan, even though I already bought my package yesterday. 
Here is my brief observations:
- Evan was awesome, and very patient with my newly discovered "workout dyslexia!"
- The space is clean and well-maintained.
- Yoga mats and weights ( of course) are provided.
- ALL coaches are HOT! I mean REALLY REALLY HOT! 


- I want to give a shoutout to Kelsey for being very very friendly and wonderful.

I think I'm going to start an obsession here. 

Five Yelps and I better get those back tits down or else!

There are no rules on what time of day it is for eating ice cream when visiting the Reading Terminal Market, because food is what it is all about and there are no boundaries. 

So after my slice of pepperoni pizza at by george, I had ice cream. You try to walk by once and stop to marvel at the sugar waffle cones being dipped into chocolate, some are then rolled into sprinkles, jimmies or nuts. 

Bassetts has been in the same spot of the Terminal since they opened in 1893 and it still has the original marble counters.  Bassetts is the last remaining of the original tenants of the Market.

Remember good old fashioned ice cream and how it used to be made with dense butterfat and rich all natural flavors? This it is and with mind blowing flavors, like champagne sorbet, where eight bottles of real champagne is used to make fifty gallons of sorbet. So I had a little drink in my sorbet, for breakfast, combined with a scoop of the apricot mango, it was delicious and refreshing. 

Even though you can have a dish of ice cream, I could not pass up one of those hand dipped cones, cake cones are also available. Sorbets, ice creams, sherbets, frozen yogurt in forty different flavors and most of them a highly unusual flavor. 

Gadzooks is Bassetts decadent chocolate ice cream with pieces of peanut butter brownies, chocolate chunks and a rich caramel swirl. The also have heath bar crunch, which was my second choice, cinnamon, Irish coffee where they use Jameson Irish whiskey mixed with rich coffee, Moose Tracks which is a dark chocolate with broken peanut butter cups though out. 

All totaled Bassetts has over one hundred different flavors, even though all are not available daily. They serve smoothies, chilled coffee drinks and more.  Vanilla is still their top seller and the French vanilla is still made with an egg yolk custard and vanilla beans.

If you have heard the name Bellissimo sorbets, ice creams and gelatos, Bassetts distributes it. Bassetts is in many ice cream parlors, restaurants and stores in Pa., De., NJ. and NY. I have since noticed that my local grocery store, Acme carries it, as well as Wawa, which is our local convenience store. 

This is the oldest ice cream maker in America folks and started by a Quaker teacher and farmer in his back yard in New Jersey. He made the ice cream with a mule turned churn, in 1861. 

In 1935 10 quarts of ice cream, packed in dry ice, was shipped via freighter from New York through the Panama Canal to the American Embassy in Tokyo. The voyage took several weeks, but the ice cream arrived in perfect condition. Bassetts Ice Cream is now available in China and being distributed to parlors, restaurants and stores. 

In 1959 50 tubs of borscht sherbet was made exclusively for and shipped to Soviet Premier Nikita Khrushchev. 

Five generations later, this family owned business is growing strong and still serving some of the richest, creamiest ice cream you will ever enjoy. 

So after our final big feast and gathering, everyone else in my group was ready for ice cream. I looked at the lines, giggled and said you go right ahead, I'll be sitting outside at one of the little cafe tables, listening to the music of the bongos and watching the crowds go by. I'm sure glad that I had my ice cream for breakfast.

The wine? Good. The tasting room? Chaotic and small with the feel of my grandmothers home.

Saturday busy with kids and dogs running amuck. The dogs I can handle but the kids were throwing corks, playing between the bar our legs and making more noise than the bachelorettes. Cute and quirky little place that looks as if it was put together with stuff from my garage. The music is a iTouch playing Pandora (nothing wrong with any of that) and played through a Bose SoundDock. The place is very noisy so maybe the music does not matter but it looks cheap and lowbrow. A lounge are with love seat and chair is the only sitting area with some high tops and the bar to stand around. It's cramped in here. There is a private tasting room with large, dining room table but it was closed off. Would be great to have a sofa in there too for overflow and there were less than 20 of us in there.

The wine is worth trying. I enjoyed the Pinot only, Purist Flight for $15. After the kids (and parents hopefully) were sent to bed and I could hear myself think, I asked the two staffers behind the bar, "What makes Drake special?" and "Why should I like it?". With so many Santa Barbara County wines to taste in the Funk Zone, I wanted to know more about Drake. The extremely friendly and knowledgeable explained the wine maker, Mark, had worked on some large Pinot projects for other, area companies and that this was a family company with a love of wine. Their story went on and made me fell like I was part of something different. This little winery produces some good stuff. 

While the wine definitely deserve a repet visit, I'll hold off all week until Fried Chicken and Waffles with Pinot Fridays. Yep. Apparently it's a real thing on the first and third Fridays through the summer and I'll be back to eat my fill. And for that, the review of the tasting room bumped up a notch.

The wine is good but I'm not a huge fan of the room. Perhaps it will grow on me. Just keep your kids at home please.
Cheers Drake

This review is all about an amazing Happy Hour!  I've been here for other things but the Happy Hour should delight just about everybody.  By the way it's 5-7 pm.

So the deal is half priced drinks and half priced appetizers.  Sounds kind of normal so far but it's absolutely not.  We're not talking well drinks here we are talking everything.  Feel free to have a premium martini at half price.  Want a glass of very nice wine; half price.  Ditto for the appetizers.  Everything is beautifully presented and delicious.

The other aspect of this Happy Hour that's great are the bartenders.  Kudos to the management for hiring some amazing people.   The icing on the cake is the bar itself.  It's beautiful and comfortable.

This Happy Hour is not new.  It's been around for many years and plenty of folks "in the know" on the mainline are tuned into it.  A quick note to folks not from the area.  If you are on Route 476 (Blue Route), it's less than two minutes off the Radnor/Route 30 exit.

Bubbletopia. Pickings are slim when it comes to finding a quality bubble tea in town. If you haven't been before, Bubbletopia is located on the second floor (take the elevator or stairs up) and has a laid back, relaxed atmosphere to it. They have a few board games that you can play (not a very good selection unless you like Jenga, Chinese chess, cards, etc.).

They have some snack options as food but I've yet to order anything besides bubble tea. Just BBT me up. The bubble tea options are endless: special mixes, milk tea, fresh fruit, powdered, green/black tea, milkshakes and juice. For the most part, I try to keep things simple and order fresh fruit.

- Fresh fruit avocado ($5.75) - finding a fresh avocado bubble tea in Edmonton is like finding a diamond in the rough. I decided to try Bubbletopia's version and sadly, it was only so-so. I subbed in grass jelly, which they were nice enough not to charge me for ($0.75 extra normally). It's hard to find fresh, quality avocados in town which is what I blame the slightly off/weird taste to. The taste did gradually get better, the more it mingled. Guess that's why most people stick with the typical flavours.
- Booboo ($5.50) and Fresh prince ($5.50) -the booboo is a blend of watermelon and strawberry with apple jelly pieces. The watermelon is more watery in general but I thoroughly enjoyed it. They could threw in more apple pieces. My friend ordered the Fresh prince and subbed out lychee pieces for sago. Her drink was much more slushy than mine. The sago was surprisingly decent. I believe they make them fresh everyday.
- Matcha green tea milkshake ($5.75) and Spirit bomb ($5.50) - really enjoyed the matcha green tea. Perfect consistency and just the right amount of green tea flavour. Might be my new favourite! The Spirit bomb, pineapple and mango slush was also on point.

This place is growing on me. Whenever I'm northside, this is the first place that pops into my mind when I want a bubble tea to drink. When you order your drinks to stay and hang out, the BBT comes in tall glasses. Cool stuff. They are open till midnight Friday and Saturday night, hopefully they start changing this to every night!

I came here about a month ago with Yelp's International Supper Club and had an amazing time! I was so impressed to see the place buzzing and busy on an otherwise uneventful weeknight. The bar was full of people, and so was the restaurant! Our group took up a longer table in the main dining area, and I have to say, our server was wonderful. So clearly happy with her job, which was refreshing to see. She took us through the specials, got our drinks out, and just did an outstanding job the entire night. 

I started with the dolma (grape leaves stuffed with lamb and beef, topped with a cream sauce) and they were really great. Very hearty, too, so maybe get some to share. For my entree I had the chicken piccata, and it was filling and flavorful. The vegetables on the side were a great touch, and I was too full to finish everything. Buuuuut apparently not too full for dessert... the cheesecake with raspberry sauce is divine.

I would absolutely come here again if I was in the area. Great service, wonderful food, and excellent service. Spiro's knows how to do it right!

I needed amattress pad and light summer blankets to wash. The place was clean and occupied by Two owners..
But I have to deduct a couple stars because they have a bathroom here that has been non-functioning for sometime. When the average length of stay at the laundromat for washing and drying is about an hour and a half most Patrons sit in their car with coffee or a soda or even breakfast and lunch. 
 So they should have a functioning bathroom!!!!
And I have to wonder if it's truly out of order because where do the attendants go? 

One extra star for Covid response. All staff are masked as well as patrons

Loud is the immediate detail I think of when it comes to this place. If that isn't a problem then grab a seat at the bar and order one of their wonderful tacos. Fish and chicken verde were both great. They also have an extensive tequila and whiskey list.

I first discovered Harbor Freight when I started prepping for my virgin experience at Burning Man.  Who knew I needed so much tarp?  Who knew tarp was so confusing?  I came here and found literally a wall of different tarps.  Then I had to buy the rope to go with the tarp.  Jeez louise, this is getting complicated.  Fortunately, a dude came over to ask me if I needed help (perhaps my frozen state of staring at the wall of tarps for 12 minutes may have indicated some indecision).  And then you go through the aisles and see things you didn't know you might need.  A trolley on wheels!  A miniature greenhouse!  Solar stake butterflies! Always a fun excursion at HF.

This place would have gotten 3 stars because SERVICE IS SO HORRIBLE, but the deliciousness of the food outweighs the service for me. 

Okay so they are only open for breakfast/lunch/brunch. Our group didn't ordered when we were supposed to because we were waiting on 2 other people. But we eventually got to order, and we waited, and waited, and waited 45 minutes for our food to arrive! The waitress kept us in the dark, she didn't tell us why our damn food was taking so long, but like 5 minutes before our food finally came out, she "apologized" for the delay because they were short staffed. Umm, you couldn't tell us that like 30 minutes ago! That way we know what's going on?! BAADD SERVICE but I guess at least she apologized? I don't know because I went in to get some bread/pastries, I didn't want to order from our table, hell no was she getting more tip then she deserved. The cashier had pretty horrible service too. She was slow, and when I got up to the line, she said "one second i'll be back" and briefly left for a minute. I was like "WTF?!" Okay, horrible service...I was angry and hungry.

Then our food finally came out, I think they served everyone who sat in the restaurant first, and then the front patio, THEN the back patio (where we sat). I was soo pissed, but I finally got my food, I ordered the smoked salmon Benedict.
